title: Best Cross-platform AI Tools - Top Picks for 2025
metaDescription: Discover the 10 best cross-platform AI tools in 2025. Compare features, pricing & reviews to find the perfect tool for your needs.
introduction: Looking for the best cross-platform AI tools in 2025? We've analyzed hundreds of tools to bring you this curated list of the top 10 options. Whether you're a developer, business, or individual user, this guide helps you choose the right cross-platform AI tool.

platforms.name: OpenCV
platforms.description: Open source computer vision and machine learning library with C++, Python, and Java interfaces supporting various platforms including mobile and embedded systems.

platforms.name: llama.cpp
platforms.description: Port of Facebook's LLaMA model in C/C++ enabling efficient inference on commodity hardware without GPU requirements.

platforms.name: ONNX Runtime
platforms.description: Cross-platform machine learning model accelerator with flexible interface to integrate hardware-specific libraries for optimized inference.

platforms.name: Apache TVM
platforms.description: Open-source machine learning compiler framework for CPUs, GPUs, and ML accelerators enabling efficient model deployment across hardware.

platforms.name: MediaPipe
platforms.description: Framework by Google for building perception pipelines processing time-series data like video, audio, and sensor data for mobile and desktop applications.

platforms.name: ONNX (Open Neural Network Exchange)
platforms.description: Open-source AI ecosystem establishing standards for representing machine learning algorithms and enabling interoperability between frameworks.

platforms.name: Stan
platforms.description: Platform for statistical modeling and high-performance statistical computation providing full Bayesian statistical inference.

platforms.name: Jan
platforms.description: Open-source ChatGPT alternative that runs 100% offline on your computer with support for various open-source language models.

platforms.name: Multiprocessing
platforms.description: Python standard library module for process-based parallelism enabling CPU-intensive machine learning tasks to utilize multiple cores.

platforms.name: SolAR Camera Calibration
platforms.description: OpenCV-based camera calibration tool for AR/VR applications with chessboard pattern support and configuration files.

verdict: All 10 cross-platform AI tools on this list are excellent choices, each with unique strengths. OpenCV leads with Computer Vision, while llama.cpp offers CPU Inference. Your best choice depends on your specific requirements, budget, and technical expertise.
